Description: String of tiny ring-shaped, tubular, bi-tubular and globular beads of glazed composition, most of them whitish to yellowish, with a few yellow, blue and green ones. two ring-shaped beads are made of red translucent glass.
Dimensions: Diameter: 0.19 centimetres (bead marked with Big No.)
Length: 0.75 centimetres (bead marked with Big No.)
Curator's comments: See W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 75 § 72 : "A large number of blue-glazed amulets and beads, &c., were found in the camp, and a selection of these will be kept together in the British Museum to show the style of known work of the twenty-sixth dynasty".
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 75 § 72)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.85, p.187, pl.29)
